Posts.Content: mkk050709 wrote: I am 29 years old and have a rapid growing lump in my breast.  I had mammo, and ultrasound done.  I also had a core biopsy done on Thursday and I am waiting on the results.  I go back to see my doc on Wednesday.  This waiting game is not fun.  I am totally exhausted from worrying about it.  I am scared and I don't know what to do.  I work at the hospital where I have had most of my testing done and the girls in the office asked me if I wanted my results when they come in or if I want to wait to talk to the doc on Wednesday.  They are expecting the results to actually be back today.  I don't know if I want to read the report myself to find out or wait to see the doctor.  What do you guys think???  Dx 7/24/2009, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/17 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Dx 9/21/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/17 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for results... mkk050709 mkk050709

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2009 02:20PM mkk050709 wrote: Well, the biopsy report came back that there were no malignant cells.  However, it showed that there were atypical cells.  The pathologists was unsure of what the cells were and suggested that it could be cause by an inflammatory process.  The doc has started me on antibiotics and will see me back in a week.  He is hoping that the antibiotics will cause it to shrink? and then we can possibly do a lumpectomy to remove it.  It is too large to do a lumpectomy now.  The doc said to remove it now, he would have to do a complete mastectomy on that side.  So...no cancerous cells is GREAT news, but it is still somewhat of a mystery.
Posts.Title: Waiting for results... mkk050709 mkk050709

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2012 04:48AM mkk050709 wrote: Hi.  I am 32 years old and was just diagnosed with stage IV mets to the lungs.  I also have 3 children (3, 5, and 7 yrs old).  Scared and heart broken.  I would also love to talk to anyone else going through this and dealing with young children.  Please pm me if you want.  Thanks
Posts.Title: ANYONE DIAGNOSED WITH STAGE IV IN EARLY TO MID 30s? lmyna2006 Kaelia

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2009 09:14PM mkk050709 wrote: I know how you must feel.  I am playing the waiting game right now, waiting for biopsy results.  I have three small children, 3 mos, 2yrs, and 4 yrs.  I am scared to death for them.  I can't stand the thought of not seeing my children grow up.
Posts.Title: New and on emotional rollercoaster AusMum vivvygirl

Posts.Content: mkk050709 wrote: I was just diagnosed as Stage IV and I had my first treatment in a clinical trial yesterday.  I am still trying to figure out what to expect with all this treatment.  My clinical trial consists of a 21 day cycle of Carboplatin and then a Parp inhibitor (veliparib; ABT-888) that is taken twice daily.  I have heard from one person that I will lose my hair...another oncologist says it will thin but not fall completely out...anyone have any experiece with Carboplatin?  I have heard that the Carboplatin is not that bad, but of course that comes from an oncologist that has never actually taken it. Any help on what to expect would be great.  Thanks. Dx 7/24/2009, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/17 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Dx 9/21/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 3/17 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CLINICAL TRIAL; includes a PARP inhibitor? Also Carboplatin mkk050709 Woodylb
